title: allow get to specify paths while staying outside of any dataset

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
as @chaselgrove ran into as a user, if you install a dataset, you can't get anything until you cd to that dataset:

``` shell
hopa:/tmp
$> datalad install -r ///dicoms

2016-09-29 20:07:05,977 [INFO   ] Installing dataset at: /tmp/dicoms (install.py:595)
2016-09-29 20:07:06,205 [INFO   ] Installing subdataset from './dartmouth-phantoms' at: ./dartmouth-phantoms (install.py:552)

hopa:/tmp
$> datalad get dicoms/rosetta/Siemens/Siemens_Trio_B12_dataset/volume_1/
2016-09-29 20:07:35,643 [ERROR  ] No dataset found [dataset.py:require_dataset:507] (NoDatasetArgumentFound) (main.py:266)
usage: datalad get [--version] [-h] [-l LEVEL] [-p {condor}] [-s LABEL]
                   [-d PATH] [-r] [--recursion-limit LEVELS]
                   [--git-opts STRING] [--annex-opts STRING]
                   [--annex-get-opts STRING] [-J NJOBS] [-v]
                   [PATH [PATH ...]]

$> cd dicoms
dartmouth-phantoms/  datapackage.json  dcm2niix-tests/  rosetta/

(git)hopa:/tmp/dicoms[master]
$> datalad get rosetta/Siemens/Siemens_Trio_B12_dataset/volume_1/       
2016-09-29 20:07:48,716 [INFO   ] Found 1 datasets to operate on. (get.py:205)
...
```

since we are 'getting' data from within subdatasets, I feel that there is no technical reason to not allow specifying paths to be 'get'ed while staying outside of those datasets altogether.
I guess to be resolved as a part of #959 or after it
